title: Travis Scott’s first single since Kylie Jenner split suggests they had long-term problems
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Rapper Travis Scott has dropped his first new track since the split from his baby mama Kylie Jenner .

The 28-year-old released the new track ‘Highest in the Room’ just days after the pair announced they were going on a break.

The track’s video and lyrics have caught the attention of fans, which seem to give a better insight into the couple’s relationship.

While the haunting track sees Travis rap about drugs, love and family, and even features him rapping about a woman - presumed to be Kylie - describing her as the “vibest”.

However, while he also raps about living “the life of la familia”, the track - which was recorded months before they parted ways - also references their relationship problems.

In the first verse, Travis raps: “She saw my eyes, she know I'm gone/I see some things that you might fear/I'm doing a show, I'll be back soon/That ain't what she wanna hear.”

(Image: FilmMagic)

The mention of a show may refer to Travis’ decisions to cancel one show on his Astroworld tour in February after reports of cheating surfaced.

However, speaking to ET at the time, Travis’ reps claimed the star was just “under the weather” and that he “vehemently denies he cheated.”

Travis and Kylie chose to put their relationship on hold a few weeks ago, with the rapper notably absent from the wedding of Justin Bieber and Hailey Baldwin in South Carolina.

Kylie attended the star-studded bash with sister Kendall.

The beauty mogul has also not posted on her social media about Travis since September 10, and the pair were last seen together in late August when she and their daughter Stormi joined him on the red carpet for the premiere of Travis’ documentary ‘Look Mom, I Can Fly’.

description: The couple, who are parents to daughter Stormi, have decided to go on a break amid rumours of cheating
